title: 103_hr1124
content: The "Housing Voucher Act of 1993" may terminate assistance for public housing construction. After the enactment of this Act, the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development is restricted from making new loans or contributions for public housing projects by public housing agencies. Existing commitments for development or acquisition of public housing projects will still be honored. The Act restricts the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development from providing new loans or contributions for public housing projects by public housing agencies. Existing commitments made before the enactment of the Act will still be honored. The provisions do not apply to public housing developed under a contract between the Secretary and an Indian housing authority. Definitions for terms like "Indian housing authority" and "public housing" are provided based on the United States Housing Act of 1937. The Act prohibits the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development from initiating new capital advances for supportive housing for the elderly under section 202(c)(1) of the Housing Act of 1959. Existing commitments made before the Act's enactment will still be honored. SEC. 4. TERMINATION OF ASSISTANCE FOR CONSTRUCTION OF SUPPORTIVE HOUSING FOR PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES. After the enactment of this Act, the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development cannot make new commitments for capital advances for supportive housing for persons with disabilities under section 811. Existing commitments can only be honored if legally binding agreements were made before the enactment of this Act. SEC. 5. INCREASE OF VOUCHER AUTHORITY AND SET-ASIDES FOR THE ELDERLY AND PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES. Budget authority under the United States Housing Act of 1937 for section 8(o) assistance can be increased by $150,000,000. The Secretary must allocate funds for voucher assistance for elderly persons and persons with disabilities based on actual need determined by the Secretary. The Secretary may increase budget authority for section 8(o) assistance by $150,000,000 and allocate funds for voucher assistance for elderly persons and persons with disabilities based on actual need. Vouchers provided under this section can be used for rental of dwelling units or residency costs by qualified recipients.
